tag_list: web, functional-creativity, concept, creative, ux, user-experience, progressive, noded, skrivr, nansen
overview:
Jaan Orvet joins Swedish-American digital agency Nansen as Head of Creative.

Digital agency and EPiServer partner recruits Orvet to build and lead the agency’s new creative team. He joins Nansen from a role as UX and Design Director at Huddle, the online collaboration tool used by more than 90 000 clients including the UK government and Disney.

Nansen’s strong technical skill set and their client track record is what attracted Orvet to the company:

  • Technical excellence is important, but only if one understands the person using the technology. Very few agencies understand the importance of this and even fewer manage to successfully combine it.

Orvet will be based in San Francisco and Chicago to develop Nansen’s service offerings with a strong focus on innovation and user experience. There he will also work closely with the agency’s partner network:

  • By adding more skills to Nansen we become an even more involved participant to partners like Simple Truth, DDB NY, Söderhavet, Great Works and Ogilvy NY.

Orvet is also the co-founder of writing app Skrivr and co-author of “Noded - The untouchable business”. Internetworld magazine listed Noded together with Twitter, Apple, Nintendo Wii, and Threadless as companies and ideas that “got it right” and are leading the way to the future.

Quote: ”I believe in leading a professional and personal life cutting out complexity, doing away with ‘extras’ and turning a blind eye to ‘feature rich’ in favor of clarity and simplicity.”

Orvet is Swedish by birth and has lived for extended periods of time in London, Stockholm, Washington D.C., and San Francisco where he now lives and works.

milestones.description: Telegraph Tech Start-up 100 Award winner, Enterprise category, with Huddle

external_links.title: Chris Heuer interviews Jaan Orvet about Noded
Internetworld lists Noded w/ Twitter, Wii, Apple as "People doing it right".
"My initial thoughts on Huddle were that it had a very simple and clean interface, easy to understand and use without reading a document or having training."  Barb Mosher, Managing Editor, CMS Wire
